lead_paragraph: SOCOL--Sheldon E.,J.D. The Yeshiva University family is deeply grieved by the passing of our esteemed alumnus and colleague, Dr. Sheldon E. Socol, of blessed memory who served as Vice President for Business Affairs for half a century in the years following his graduation from our then affiliated Brooklyn High School for Boys, and Yeshiva College, and his earning a law degree from the New York University Law School. His wife and all their children are alumni of Yeshiva University Schools. He devoted his efforts to strengthen our institution through his management of the of the University's finances and was committed to the mission of Torah U'Madda as well as to the advancement of each school's goals. Heartfelt condolences are extended to his wife, Genia "Ginger" Socol and their children, Jeffrey (and Robin) Steven (and Leslie) and Sharon (Sura) and (Steven) Tuchman and their grandchildren. May they be comforted among all whom mourn for Zion and Jerusalem. Yeshiva University Richard M. Joel, President Norman Lamm, President Emeritus 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SOCOL, SHELDON E.
